laws.full_text:
t earn more than 250% of the federal poverty level
Notice requirement: n/a
Exceptions: Banned for non-exempt employees, student interns, employees age 18 or younger, and certain medical professionals
South Carolina

Reasonableness requirement: Must be reasonable in duration, geographic scope, and activities prohibited
Specific duration limit: n/a
Wage threshold: n/a
Notice requirement: n/a
Exceptions: n/a
South
laws.suggestion: Remove the non-compete clause entirely as it is restricted under South Carolina law for non-exempt employees, student interns, employees age 18 or younger, and certain medical professionals. For exempt employees, modify the non-compete clause to include specific reasonable duration, geographic scope, and activity restrictions, such as: "The employee agrees not to engage in any competing business within a 50-mile radius of South Carolina for a period of 12 months after termination." Ensure the clause is tailored to the employee's position and responsibilities.

laws.suggestion: Remove salary history questions. Replace with: 'Please provide your salary expectations for this role in South Carolina,' to comply with the state's salary history ban, which prohibits employers from inquiring about a candidate's prior salary history.

review_notes.next_steps: Verify statute citations and effective dates
